text: this video was sponsored by curiosity
stream some of the abilities players can
unlock in this game are downright broken
from the stealth piercing power of
electroreception
to the stamina regenerative power of
sweating to the survivability of
cryptobiosis it seems like every build
in the game has at least one or two
abilities that define their playstyle
and grant them a unique edge in the
competitive meta but there's one ability
that more than any other sparks jealousy
in the hearts of players that don't have
it flight it's been unlocked by only
four factions in the history of the game
first it was insects then pterosaurs
then birds and finally mammals I'm not
going to beat around the bush here
flight is one of the most overpower
abilities in the game it has a vast
array of uses and implications
offensively defensively and for general
utility so today we're going to take a
look at why flight is one of the most
broken ability as a character can have
will look at both the perks and
drawbacks of playing a flying build
being able to take to the air grants
several advantages to predator players
most players have their field of view
settings optimized for a horizontal
field of view making it easy to see
approaches from the left and right but
difficult to see an attack coming from
above in addition it's much easier to
detect an imminent attack on the ground
via sound perhaps more importantly
ground-based targets will most likely
possess combat options that are most
effective against other grounded
opponents attacks like charge bite and
stop are generally much less accurate
against airborne opponents on the flip
side even if your build sports
relatively low base attack power flight
offers a few ways to mitigate this first
the dive attack is a viable offensive
move even for bills with low base power
that can deal heavy damage in spite of
lacking power stats because it's damaged
skills with mobility rather than power
so the faster you're moving on is
weakened
the more damage it does secondly when
facing an opponent with defense is too
sturdy to be damaged by your basic
attacks you can oftentimes still defeat
them as long as you can score a grab
after that all you need to do is carry
them high into the sky and that fall
damage to four so obviously in terms of
offensive capabilities a flying build
can add a lot of powerful options to
your arsenal but how about for defense
being able to fly isn't only useful for
predator builds it has plenty of uses
for avoiding being preyed upon to
surviving as a prey build requires
mastery of at least one of several
potential tactics including stealth
evasion counter-attacks and armor the
ability to fly massively improves a
player's evasion I think it's pretty
self-explanatory but yeah in most cases
during flight you're immune to attacks
from non flying opponents important to
note that I said in most cases not all
cases but yeah rather than having to
worry about armor stealth intimidation
or counter attacks generally all a
flying player needs to do to dodge
attacks is take off if you're proud it's
perhaps the quickest most effective
escape option in the game leaving you
basically only vulnerable to stealth
attacks or attacking other flying
players and if you're worried about self
attacks
I see very well should be the other main
defensive advantage flying builds have
is being able to land in places that
other players can't reach places like
treetops are great for avoiding most
stealth bills although with enough
points spent on climbing or arboreal
mobility it is possible for them to
reach you to truly escape you'll want to
find a cliffside completely untouchable
by non flying bills except for maybe the
mountain goat but thankfully they're not
aggressive in addition to being
protected from terrestrial players
attacking you flying also allows you to
avoid many of the dangerous random
events that the game occasionally throws
at you for example while terrestrial and
arboreal Bilt's are likely to get caught
in a wildfire aerial bills don't have
much trouble escaping and in a drought
it's far easier for a player to find the
necessary water to survive when they can
serve a huge amounts of land from the
sky rather than say hopping along the
ground
[Music]
in addition to surviving life or death
situations flood has plenty of other
applications to accessing exclusive
locations on the map isn't only good for
evading predators a lot of exclusive
loot is reachable only by being able to
hover or fly which is why builds like
the fruit bat are so successful despite
their mediocre stats but perhaps the
most important utility aspect of flight
is that can be used to fast travel very
few players have the ability to visit
other servers with ease let alone ones
that are far apart flag builds on the
other hand frequently change servers
sometimes to find food and sometimes to
avoid ice damage during the winter /
world event and when I say fast travel
I'm not talking about how convenient and
direct to this flight genuinely is also
an extremely fast-moving option there is
a reason that when discussing cheetahs
and how fast they are there's a big fat
asterisk next to their record speed
because if you included flying bills she
does wouldn't even be in the top 10 and
if you include diving speed they pale in
comparison
[Music]
so obviously the ability to fly is opie
but I don't want to give you the
impression that it doesn't come with any
drawbacks at all there are two main ones
that I want to highlight the first is
that simply to gain access to the flight
ability requires a pretty heavy
sacrifice to HP and defense because
you're forced suspect into the hollow
bones attribute in order to be light
enough to fly hollow bones are quite
weak to crush damage meaning that being
hit with any significant blow can often
break a wing which is almost always a
game over players also experience crush
damage during a collision so if you
aren't careful while flying and run into
something that can also do huge damage
because insects don't have an
endoskeleton they don't suffer this same
penalty and are actually quite resistant
to crush damage compared to similarly
sized bats or birds the other drawback
is that during flight you're obviously
high above the ground and moving very
quickly and being in this state can make
stealth highly effective against you for
this reason all flying builds that want
to play as a predator are forced to
spend a ton of evolution points
levelling up their eyesight since basic
eyes would be useless in spotting
stealthy targets below so hopefully now
you have a good grasp of the benefits
and drawbacks to the powerful ability
if you'd like to see aerial builds in
action there are plenty of excellent
documentaries I can recommend for fliers
from present date I highly recommend
jeweled messengers a documentary on
hummingbirds and for fliers of the past
there's a fantastic episode of ancient
earth that deals with the evolution of
feathers in dinosaurs both of which can
be found on curiosity stream the best
place on the internet for high-quality
educational content it was created by
the man behind the Discovery Channel and
in addition to the stuff that I just
recommended it also features some of my

Walking with Dinosaurs out of the cradle
